title: Recreating company logo from truck tautliner
content:
G'day.

I'm trying to identify the typeface used in this company logo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131112043527im_/http:/typophile.com/files/yugo_4353.gif)

I've attempted to straighten it up from this photo (so you can see it in context).  
 [http://www.yugodrivingschool.com.au/b-double.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131112043527/http:/www.yugodrivingschool.com.au/b-double.jpg "http://www.yugodrivingschool.com.au/b-double.jpg")

I've tried Identifont & WhatTheFont, but no luck.

It resembles a Letraset font I saw when I was a kid, but no luck on the Letraset fonts either.

Thanks in advance.  
Warwick
author: WarWraith

comments.content:
It's similar to Compacta Black (although the 'G' is beardless), and there might be a font in the Filmotype G series that looks like this, but I'm not sure they got this wide or bold. Mark Simonson might know the answer to that one.

- Lex
